newsitem.title: GERMANY: Waigel to respond to SPD tax position Wednesday.
newsitem.headline: Waigel to respond to SPD tax position Wednesday.

text.p: German Finance Minister Theo Waigel said on Tuesday he would respond on Wednesday to written conditions put by the opposition Social Democrats (SPD) for a resumption of talks on tax reforms.

Speaking before a meeting of Christian Democrat deputies, Waigel added that he expected more contacts with the SPD over talks the opposition party broke off last week in protest at government plans to cut coal subsidies.
"We'll see what happens after Easter," Waigel told reporters.
Waigel said he had been in touch with several SPD leaders on Tuesday to sound out chances of resuming cross-party talks on his plans to slash 30 billion marks in taxes by 1999.
